1:
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,\q and his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
\q
2:
Let the redeemed of Yahweh speak out,\q those he has rescued from the hand of the enemy.
\q
3:
He has gathered them out of foreign lands,\q from the east and from the west,
\q from the north and from the south.


\q
4:
They wandered in the wilderness on a desert road\q and found no city in which to live.
\q
5:
Because they were hungry and thirsty,\q they fainted from exhaustion.
\q
6:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,\q and he rescued them out of their distress.
\q
7:
He led them by a direct path\q so that they would go to a city to live in.


\q
8:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
9:
For he satisfies the longings of those who are thirsty,\q and the desires of those who are hungry he fills up with good things.
\q
10:
Some sat in darkness and in gloom,\q prisoners in affliction and chains.


\q
11:
This was because they had rebelled against God's word\q and rejected the instruction of the Most High.
\q
12:
He humbled their hearts through hardship;\q they stumbled and there was no one to help them up.
\q
13:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,\q and he brought them out of their distress.


\q
14:
He brought them out of darkness and gloom\q and broke their bonds.
\q
15:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
16:
For he has broken the gates of bronze\q and cut through the bars of iron.


\q
17:
They were foolish in their rebellious ways\q and afflicted because of their sins.
\q
18:
They lost their desire to eat any food,\q and they came close to the gates of death.
\q
19:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,\q and he brought them out of their distress.


\q
20:
He sent his word and healed them,\q and he rescued them from their destruction.
\q
21:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
22:
Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving\q and proclaim his deeds in singing.


\q
23:
Some travel on the sea in ships\q and do business overseas.
\q
24:
These saw the deeds of Yahweh\q and his wonders on the seas.


\q
25:
For he commanded and aroused the windstorm\q that stirs up the seas.
\q
26:
They reached up to the sky; they went down to the depths.\q Their lives melted away in distress.
\q
27:
They swayed and staggered like drunkards\q and were at their wits' end.


\q
28:
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble,\q and he brought them out of their distress.
\q
29:
He calmed the storm,\q and the waves were stilled.
\q
30:
Then they rejoiced because the sea was calm,\q and he brought them to their desired harbor.


\q
31:
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness\q and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
\q
32:
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people\q and praise him in the council of the elders.


\q
33:
He turns rivers into a wilderness,\q springs of water into dry land,
\q
34:
and a fruitful land into a barren place\q because of the wickedness of its people.
\q
35:
He turns the wilderness into a pool of water\q and dry land into springs of water.


\q
36:
He settles the hungry there,\q and they build a city to live in.
\q
37:
They build a city to plant fields in, to plant vineyards,\q and to bring in an abundant harvest.
\q
38:
He blesses them so they are very numerous.\q He does not let their cattle decrease in number.


\q
39:
They were diminished and brought low\q by painful distress and suffering.
\q
40:
He pours contempt on the leaders\q and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there are no roads.


\q
41:
But he protects the needy from affliction\q and cares for his families like a flock.
\q
42:
The upright will see this and rejoice,\q and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
\q
43: Whoever is wise should take note of these things\q and meditate on Yahweh's acts of covenant faithfulness.
